info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 4 at 4:47PM MDT until September 4 at 6:45PM MDT by NWS Grand Junction CO
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of west central Colorado, including the following county, Mesa.
* WHEN...Until 645 PM MDT.
* IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 447 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.3 and 0.9 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages near... Hunter Wash, Ladder Creek and Leach Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Redlands and areas near eastern side of the Colorado National Monument. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM MDT THIS EVENING
